content:
What a great idea! Mentioning the wedding day in the message can make it even more personal and special. Here are some ideas to get you started:

**Highlight a special moment:**

* "Emma and Michael, I'll never forget the look on your faces when you exchanged your vows. It was pure magic. Congratulations on your wedding day and your new life together!"
* "The way you danced your first dance as husband and wife is a memory I'll cherish forever. Wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness."

**Mention a specific detail:**

* "The flowers, the decorations, the music – every detail of your wedding day was perfection. Congratulations, Emma and Michael, on your beautiful celebration of love!"
* "I loved the personal touches you incorporated into the ceremony, like the special song you chose for the processional. It was such a beautiful tribute to your love story."

**Reference a memorable speech or toast:**

* "Emma's father's speech had me in tears (happy tears, of course!). It was such a beautiful tribute to your love and commitment to each other. Congratulations on your wedding day!"
* "Michael's toast to Emma was so heartfelt and sincere. It was clear how much you adore each other. Cheers to a lifetime of love and happiness!"

**Capture the atmosphere:**

* "The love and joy in the air on your wedding day was palpable. It was an honor to be a part of it. Congratulations, Emma and Michael!"
* "The way the sun set during the reception, casting a warm glow over everything, was like nature's own blessing on your union. Wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness."

Remember to be sincere and genuine in your message. You can mix and match these ideas or add your own personal touch to make it truly special.
